title: AFM-graphTypes
text: AFM image can displayed using graphTypes:

title: AFM-graphTypes
text: basic default graph AFM image:

title: AFM-graphTypes
text: graph square shape adds bar length 20%; places scale inside graph.  image can saved ggsave graphed ggplot.
code: plot(afmd, graphType=2) #> Graphing: HeightRetrace g1 = plot(afmd, graphType=2) #> Graphing: HeightRetrace ggsave(tempfile(pattern = "", fileext = ".png"), plot=g1, dpi=300) #> Saving 7.29 x 4.51 in image

title: AFM-graphTypes
text: graph type bare neither length scales legend.
code: plot(afmd, graphType=3) #> Graphing: HeightRetrace summary(afmd) #>         object               description resolution           size #> 1 Cypher Image KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  128 x 128 4000 x 4000 nm #> 2 Cypher Image KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  128 x 128 4000 x 4000 nm #> 3 Cypher Image KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  128 x 128 4000 x 4000 nm #> 4 Cypher Image KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  128 x 128 4000 x 4000 nm #>            channel history     z.min    z.max z.units #> 1    HeightRetrace         -32.45992 50.78832      nm #> 2 AmplitudeRetrace          29.00730 32.78488      nm #> 3     PhaseRetrace          63.92822 85.18923     deg #> 4   ZSensorRetrace         -29.44336 48.16414      nm

title: AFM-graphTypes
text: Use package cowplot create graph two plots. Use save_plot save graph.
code: library(cowplot) fname2 = AFM.getSampleImages(type='ibw')[1] afmd2 = AFM.import(fname2) summary(afmd2) #>         object               description resolution           size #> 1 Cypher Image KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  128 x 128 4000 x 4000 nm #> 2 Cypher Image KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  128 x 128 4000 x 4000 nm #> 3 Cypher Image KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  128 x 128 4000 x 4000 nm #> 4 Cypher Image KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  128 x 128 4000 x 4000 nm #>            channel history     z.min    z.max z.units #> 1    HeightRetrace         -32.45992 50.78832      nm #> 2 AmplitudeRetrace          29.00730 32.78488      nm #> 3     PhaseRetrace          63.92822 85.18923     deg #> 4   ZSensorRetrace         -29.44336 48.16414      nm g1 = plot(afmd, trimPeaks=0.01, graphType = 3) #> Graphing: HeightRetrace g2 = plot(afmd2, no=2, trimPeaks=0.01, graphType = 3, mpt=29.6) #> Graphing: AmplitudeRetrace g3 = plot(afmd, no=3, trimPeaks=0.01, graphType = 3, mpt=65.5) #> Graphing: PhaseRetrace g4 = plot(afmd, no=4, trimPeaks=0.01, graphType = 3) #> Graphing: ZSensorRetrace plot_grid(g1, g2, g3, g4,           labels=c('A','B','C','D'))

title: afm-setpoint
text: can find setpoint information AFM image retrieving AFMinfo. example: Basic information image can also viewed, AFMinfo object: Finding additional special information, using function AFMinfo.item; note search string case-sensitive. names items can found function; list first item names can used:
code: library(nanoscopeAFM)  # loading the test file from the nanoscopeAFM package filename = (system.file("extdata","AR_20211011.ibw",package="nanoscopeAFM")) # retrieving an AFMinfo object h = AFMinfo(filename) # generate a summary of the AFMinfo object summary(h) #> AFM image type:   Cypher  #> Resolution:        128 x  128  #> Channels:          #> Scan rate (Hz):    2.0032  #> Scan Angle (deg):  #> Notes:            KC200, FePc, KC20170720Si  #> Data Items:       706 sp =  AFMinfo.item(h, 'Setpoint') print(paste("Setpoint:",sp,"V")) #> [1] "Setpoint:  0.74347 V" allNames = AFMinfo.item(h) print(allNames[1:50]) #>  [1] "ScanSize"         "FastScanSize"     "SlowScanSize"     "ScanRate"         #>  [5] "XOffset"          "YOffset"          "PointsLines"      "ScanPoints"       #>  [9] "ScanLines"        "ScanAngle"        "ImagingMode"      "InvOLS"           #> [13] "SpringConstant"   "AmpInvOLS"        "Amp2Invols"       "FastRatio"        #> [17] "SlowRatio"        "TopLine"          "BottomLine"       "ScanMode"         #> [21] "NapMode"          "FMapScanTime"     "FMapScanPoints"   "FMapScanLines"    #> [25] "FMapXYVelocity"   "FMapBookWise"     "Channel1DataType" "DataTypeSum"      #> [29] "PhaseOffset"      "PhaseOffset1"     "NapPhaseOffset"   "VoltageParm"      #> [33] "NapParms"         "PreScanSetting"   "OrcaOffset"       "OrcaOffset2"      #> [37] "UserIn0Gain"      "UserIn0Offset"    "UserIn1Gain"      "UserIn1Offset"    #> [41] "UserIn2Gain"      "UserIn2Offset"    "LateralGain"      "LateralOffset"    #> [45] "OrcaGain"         "OrcaGain2"        "FastMapScanRate"  "FastMapZRate"     #> [49] "dcdvPhaseOffset"  "dcdZPhaseOffset"

title: Import and analyze AFM images
text: Imports analyzes Atomic Force Microsocpy images; currently four types supported, images Nanosurf (.nid), Veeco Multimode Nanoscope III (.000), Park AFM images (.tiff), Asylum Research AFM images (.ibw).

title: Import and analyze AFM images
text: Use latest release GitHub repository:

title: Import and analyze AFM images
text: Several new data structures (S3 S4) introduced: AFMdata - S4 class contains AFM images file AFMinfo - S3 class contains parameters AFM images, vibration frequnecy, etc. AFMmath - S3 class contains computed paramters, roughness, etc. particular AFM image

title: Import and analyze AFM images
text: Complete descriptions nanoscopeAFM library functions examples Article Vignettes. Use package generate AFMdata S4 data objects, can used quickly display AFM data also process AFM data. examples: Creating AFMdata data object: Print essential data output summary: Graph object using ggplot2 package:
code: d = AFM.import('image.ibw') class(d) print(d) summary(d) plot(d)

title: Import and analyze AFM images
text: Use AFMinfo() function obtain information AFM image. information depends file format, items common images; items start “INFO.”. AFM image information can also saved file.
code: r1 = AFMinfo(fname) summary(fname) write.csv(r1$data, file='AFMinfo.csv', row.names = FALSE)

title: Import and analyze AFM images
text: Several functions available image analysis, including: Flatten image Histogram Profile lines Roughness analysis

title: Import and analyze AFM images
text: least significant bit (LSB) provides smallest voltage step, given 16-bit resolution NanoScope AFM, Vref = 2^16*LSB. header file documented versions 2,3, 4. Z-scaling Info Low Cost DIY AFM AFM Analysis R package Mathieu Beauvais cran/AFM
